alert.note: Alert for Mobile Central (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 12:20AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL MOBILE COUNTY THROUGH 100 AM CST... At 1219 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tanner Williams, or 10 miles west of Midtown Mobile, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saraland, Chickasaw, Satsuma, Creola, Chunchula, Semmes, Tanner Williams, I65 And I165, I65 And AL 158, and Mobile Regional Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
